questions.text: The atomic symbol for krypton is:
questions.explanation:
Kr.

	'K' is potassium (Latin: {kalium);} 'Sm' is Samarium (not Superman). 'Kt' is not a valid symbol.

questions.text: The name krypton is Greek for:
questions.explanation:
hidden.

	Greek 'kryptos'. Krypton exists in the Earth's atmosphere at only one part per million. In comparison, oxygen exists at 200,000 ppm, so krypton is indeed hidden.

questions.text: Krypton's major spectral lines are these two colors:
questions.explanation:
orange and green.

	The orange-red spectral line of Kr-86 was the basis for the 'meter' measurement of the Metric System.

questions.text: Krypton has 6 stable isotopes. The longest lived of its unstable isotopes has a half-life of:
questions.explanation:
210,000 years.

	Kr-81 has a half-life of 210,000 years. It is sandwiched between two stable isotopes: Kr-80 and Kr-82.

questions.text: Krypton is grouped in this classification group:
questions.explanation:
noble gas.

	As such, it does not readily form compounds with other elements. However, compounds with fluoride and molecule-ions with other noble gases have been identified.
